title: LP Gain/Loss affected by AFK players
body:
Recently a friend of mine finished his placements at a final record of 2-8 with 6 of those losses being due to AFK players. I submitted a furiously written support ticket and was given this response:

(Edit - here is the full ticket: http://prntscr.com/qoz9gl )

"Hey there FancyPants,
Thanks for reaching out to us. The community can get very frustrating at times, and we're doing our very best to improve it. Of course, it's not a one man job, and your reports are one of, if not the most important piece for us to do something about these problems within our playerbase.
I do agree that there should be some sort of leeway in terms of losing a game due to players AFKing. It'd be good to see it happen. It's a very good idea.
This is gonna be a bummer but sadly, I am unable to send this directly to our devs but I highly recommend to post this idea in the boards since the devs check those from time to time, believe me.
Who knows? Maybe if enough players chime in to the discussion and it gains enough traction, the devs might consider doing a rework in the matchmaking system.
If you have any additional questions or concerns, don't hesitate to let me know.
ðŸ¤  ~ Auggie ~ ðŸ¤ 
Riot Games Player Support"

AFK players mean more than players that have disconnected for longer than the DC grace period. Players that just sit around in fountain are more harmful to a game than someone that will fill team chat with toxic behavior or even flat out leave. These players are still allowed to determine our league of legends experience with little harm to them and absolutely no compensation to us.

Now I know not making an argument or suggestion will get me nowhere so here's a few quick thoughts:
1: Matchmake people with a large amount of AFK reports or leaverbuster warnings/offenses together; keep them out of the games with players that actually want to win. The amount of offenses/reports should not decrease depending on how many games they play until the end but rather after a set amount of time, 3 patches for example.
2: Compensate the players that were forced into a loss with a portion of the LP that they lost. This can't be done instantly at the end of games but the process should be automated to determine if there was a leaver based on an amount of reports or if a player was disconnected past the grace period. This should also be a process that can be appealed due to abuse of report stacking (x9'ing, etc.). 
3: The "Life happens, we get it.." loading tip _should_ still apply. Give all players 2 or 3 games in which disconnecting is not punishable, but allow certain keywords in the report screen to appeal that thought. If a player rage quits it should not count towards their allotted disconnected games.
4: Rewrite a page out of DOTA 2's book. Instead of placing players that leave in a lower priority queue, you should also place players that consistently play out games in a higher priority queue. That does _not_ mean that more players should be autofilled in games as that happens enough. I'm sure there's a gritty way of figuring out that system but that's a topic for another time.

Thank you for reading my ideas on this subject. Just as Riot Auggie said, it's up to us to bring this to the attention of the devs as it's not something anyone else can do. Upvote this here on boards, post it on Reddit, retweet it, share it on facebook, 4chan even, I don't care. AFK players defining the experience of the game for everyone is unacceptable and it's time that there were a few changes made to the way it's handled.

replies.body: Great idea, I'll tweak it a little bit. The afker loses double lp, his party loses normal lp (disincentivizing it for all involved while not screwing over the party member). Then you can give reduced losses to the rest of the team. To be honest though, the LP isn't the only issue, you shouldn't lose any MMR from afk teammate loses either.

I like most of this except for the party aspect. I understand that itâ€™d be in place to prevent abuse of just telling your duo partner to leave, but I feel thatâ€™d be unfair if I lost increased LP because I duoâ€™d with someone new who then decided to AFK. Itâ€™s not uncommon to finish a good game and to friend a teammate to duo only to find out how toxic they are when they actually lose lane. Itâ€™s hard to determine which is just, and whether the collateral LP loss is worth it.

An issue I have is the LP loss due to AFK tag. I was recently in a match where my power flickered on and off, I frantically logged back onto my computer by the time my computer booted, and league opened up, the match was still going on, so I rejoined my team and helped win the match. Although when I loaded the lobby I noticed I lost 15 LP.... for winning a match. Why did I bother rejoining... this type of punishment encourages toxic behavior. if I'm going to lose LP for DC'ing on accident or not why the hell would I rejoin to help my team win.
They need to fix that. The exact same thing has happened to me as well.

"Hey we are losing, can you leave so we lose less lp?"
"Sure np, i still have 1 non-punished leave for this week"
How are you going to solve this?

A cocktail of honesty and maybe chat log monitoring. Typically if a player rage quits riot can see the difference between a random dc and an actual rq. They could use the same methodology or even lengthen the amount of time it takes to expunge leaver penalties. My initial idea was somewhere around 5 months so your record gets clean around preseason, as that's a system set in place by a former employer regarding attendance, but that seemed a little too harsh.

> chat log monitoring

I can do the same using voice/whatever other communication tool i have

> Typically if a player rage quits riot can see the difference between a random dc and an actual rq

It depends. I can switch off my wifi router myself, or it could just shut down by itself, no real difference and no way to check which one is which

This would create a huge inequality because feeding, which is not punishable, can make a game just as unfair and unwinnable as someone who is AFK. Why should you lose less LP because someone goes AFK after 10 minutes, but not when your botlane is 0/20?

Antual inting and being bad/dying a lot are very different. You can already report people for inting if they really are inting. I've gotten back insta reports from reporting inters so action IS taken sometimes.
It also becomes the whole "If you are better then your rank you'd be able to carry an inter" total bullshit people still like to use that line.
In this case it doesn't matter if its intentional or not. If your botlane goes 0/20 your chances of winning are just as low as if someone is AFK.

Have you never played a game 4v5 that is instantly unwinnable because of the enemy top laner permanently split pushing and thought "wow I sure wish my 0/6 top laner was here simply for lane pressure."? It seems so miniscule but it makes a big difference.

It depends on the game state and the champions. The game may be winnable with an 0/6 toplaner, but its not going to be winnable when the enemy ADC gets 10 kills in lane.

Feeding isn't necessarily something you can ban 100% of games. People have bad games, it happens. Sometimes it happens frequently. But _intentionally_ feeding is absolutely uncalled for and I believe that some of my ideas could even transfer to those people. Your 0/20 botlane might have gotten stomped, but were they running under the enemy tower or laugh spamming giving free kills in the middle of the lane?
All in all, feeding players and AFK players are different issues and should be addressed at different times in different ways. You can't expect everything to get fixed revolving around the inconsistencies of humans at one time.
Why wouldn't the same logic be applied to AFKing then? AFKing/DCing happens. And unless someone announces that they are going to do it, how do you know if its intentional or not?

You track it.  DCing happens yes.  It happens to me some times when comcast is being a bitch but its maybe 1/20+ games.

If someone is "DCing" 1/5 games they have one of two issues

1) They are just giving up and quitting
2) They have shit connection and should not be allowed to pull down everyone they are teamed with.

No matter the "Issue" if you are afk more then like 1/20 games you should not be allowed to play Ranked.
Why should YOUR Connection issues be MY problem?
So should people who feed in 1/20 games also not be allowed to play? Why should THEIR feeding be MY problem?

It's not only your problem, it's everyone's. It gives LP to an enemy team that might not deserve it as well as pulling it away from you and your teammates. However, that bot lane _is_ punished. They lose LP too, and the more they play like that, the more they fall, until they are put into a rank that they belong.

This goes back to my original point. Why is that different from AFKing? People who AFK also lose LP. How would it be fair to lose full LP when your botlane gets stomped by a duo, but not losing as much LP when your toplaner ragequits at 15 and your team is already down 10k gold?  If you don't see both cases as being unfair, then why do you think you should have LP compensation when someone is AFK?

A player disconnecting from a game makes that game unwinnable 9/10 times. Even if your bot lane does poorly they are still on the map applying pressure or even just being a meat shield. But as I said before, these are different issues and should be addressed at different times and in different ways.
Your botlane getting stomped makes a game unwinnable 9/10 times. Having an autofilled jungler makes the game unwinnable 9/10 times. That shouldn't be a basis for LP compensation.
I never said I disagreed.
I lose more game's to "bad players" then i do to afk's/leavers. The amount of game's lost because bot gets destroyed while i go even or better top is mad. I'd like some compensation ;)

Feeding is different the DC/afk

Some people are trying and feed.  Some do it to troll.

Riot can tell the blatant feeders and will punish them (should do more then what they do personally like blocking them from playing Ranked)

But I do agree that if Riot finds that the player trolled then the match should just be scratched from the league.   

What happens to a Football game when a player throws the game (like for money) or cheats to win?

I'm talking about this from the standpoint of LP compensation.  When it comes to losing a game for unfair reasons, teammates feeding and someone AFKing/DCing are no different. Both are things you cannot control. Why should one be treated differently from the other?

It's simple. For every 1 ranked game flagged as AFK. Player has to play 10 straight Coop vs AI games without AFKing even once. If you afk it resets.

Now the thing is, how do you prevent people from being pseudo-afk. Which means moving and playing but just to protect your KDA and avoid leaverbuster... That's the real hard thing to do.
pseudo-afkers are the worst, I wish there was something we could do about them.

There are things riot could do. But they don't care about it. Or rather they don't care about it enough to allocate resources to player-behaviour related issues. That won't bring immediate money in. So it's a net loss if you work with a semi-annual mindset.

I know you know, that Riot ain't gonna try that, because "It will encourage players to abuse and bully their teammates into leaving, just to save a bit of LP". It doesn't even matter if you personally agree with that argument. That's just how Riot looks at the problem, and has looked at it for a decade. That kind of solution might help a little, but for every leaver that it discourages, it probably will create a new type of jerk that gives up and spends the rest of the game trying to bully someone else into leaving.

The only way this problem gets solved is by baiting players into finishing a game, with positive rewards that keep the team working together. (For example, losing less LP if you're team put up a good fight, by stealing an objective or winning a teamfight, before losing in the long-run.) Lopsided punishments for leavers will just lead to more bickering about leavers, and make people focus on the dilemma between sticking around with shitty teams vs. losing more LP. Really, just framing things in a less negative way would help a lot of players from getting burnt-out and giving up early.

The problem is Riot uses an Elo system. Elo is zero sum, meaning the other team gains as many points as you lose. In order for they to reduce the points you lost they would have to do one of 3 things

1) Reduce the points gained by the other team(not fair at all)
2) Increase the points lost by the AFK offender(not fair to those who legitimately DC an easy to troll with)
3) adopt a new system. This one could potential work. But i highly doubt Riot would do it.
